0.title: Sheryl Sandberg pressurised news site to drop stories about ex-boyfriend: Report
0.article_body: Meta COO Sheryl Sandberg twice pressurised the Daily Mail to abandon reporting damaging stories about her then-boyfriend, Activision CEO Bobby Kotick, as per a report. Sandberg reportedly contacted the Daily Mail in 2016 and 2019 as it worked on stories that revealed that one of Kotick’s former girlfriends had obtained a temporary restraining order against him in 2014.

1.title: 24-year-old woman stabbed to death in front of her kids in Delhi
1.article_body: A 24-year-old woman was allegedly stabbed to death in front of her two minor sons in Southwest Delhi on Thursday, police said. The woman was stabbed, allegedly by a man she used to know, while heading home from a market, police added. The accused and the woman used to live nearby before she moved to another place, police stated.

2.title: B'luru police arrest 3 accused in 5 theft cases, seize 9.9 kg items
2.article_body: Bengaluru's Rajarajeshwari Nagar police have conducted an operation and arrested three people accused in five theft cases, the city's Deputy Commissioner of Police (West Division) Sanjeev M Patil tweeted on Thursday. He added that the police also seized 375 gm of jewellery and 9.573 kg of silverware along with two vehicles. Furthermore, he also shared a picture of the seizure.

3.title: NIIT’s online program offers 100% placements in digital marketing
3.article_body: NIIT's full-stack digital marketing program aims to transform first-time job seekers into job-ready professionals by equipping them with 360⁰ industry-ready competencies and soft skills. NIIT revealed the online program is developed to enable learners with skills like website development, e-commerce optimization, social media management, SEO and SEM, ROI optimization and more.

4.title: Virender Sehwag shares Ajay Devgn meme after MS Dhoni finishes run chase for CSK
4.article_body: After CSK wicketkeeper-batter MS Dhoni scored 16 runs off the last four deliveries to help CSK defeat MI on the last ball, Virender Sehwag shared a meme of Ajay Devgn's dialogue from 'Golmaal Again'. The meme read, "Kuchh nahi badla yaar. Aaj bhi sab kuchh waisa ka waisa hi hai (Nothing has changed. Everything is how it was even today)."

5.title: Why is Sachin's 143-run Sharjah knock called Desert Storm?
5.article_body: On April 22, 1998, Sachin Tendulkar scored 143 runs off 131 balls against Australia in Sharjah to ensure India's spot in the tri-series final. The match was interrupted by a sandstorm and the knock came to be popularly known as the 'Desert Storm'. Tendulkar went on to score another hundred two days later to help India win the tri-series.

6.title: Musk's Starlink signs 1st deal to provide in-flight WiFi
6.article_body: Elon Musk-owned SpaceX has signed its first deal with an air carrier to provide in-flight WiFi using the Starlink satellite network. As part of the deal, signed with semi-private jet service JSX, 100 aeroplanes will be equipped with Starlink terminals. The first flight having the terminal is expected to fly by the end of this year.

7.title: Betting addict commits theft at brother-in-law's house in Hyderabad, held
7.article_body: A 29-year-old man was arrested for committing theft at his brother-in-law's house in Hyderabad. Police also seized ₹85 lakh cash from the accused. According to police, the accused, identified as Mahander Kumar, was allegedly addicted to cricket betting. On April 15, he broke into his brother-in-law Bhomaram's house using a duplicate key and stole the money, police said.

8.title: If Twitter bid succeeds, will defeat spam bots or die trying: Musk
8.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk in a tweet said that if their Twitter acquisition offer succeeds, they will "defeat all spambots or die trying!" In another tweet posted on Friday he said, "And authenticate all real humans." Musk also said that he has lined up $46.5 billion in financing to acquire Twitter and is considering taking his offer directly to shareholders.

9.title: Delhi Election Commission suspends preparations for civic body polls
9.article_body: State Election Commissioner of Delhi SK Srivastava, before his retirement on Wednesday, put on hold the preparations for the municipal corporation polls. The civic body elections were scheduled to be held in April. This comes after the Central government notified the Delhi Municipal Corporation (Amendment) Act, 2022, merging Delhi's East, South and North Delhi Municipal Corporations into one.

10.title: Terrorists attack bus carrying CISF personnel in J&K; terrorists forced to run away
10.article_body: A bus carrying 15 Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) personnel was attacked by terrorists in Jammu on Friday. "CISF averted the terrorist attack, retaliated effectively, and forced the terrorists to run away," CISF officials said. "In the line of action one ASI lost his life and two others were injured," said a senior officer of the CISF.

11.title: Legends use same game plan for 10+ years: Jaffer on Dhoni setting field for Pollard
11.article_body: Former India opener Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to share a picture of CSK wicketkeeper MS Dhoni setting the field for Kieron Pollard a ball before his dismissal. Referring to Pollard getting out in similar fashion earlier as well, Jaffer wrote, "Kids use same barber for 10+ years...Adults use same dp for 10+ years...Legends use same gameplan for 10+ years."

12.title: Mumbai Indians record worst-ever start to an IPL season by any team
12.article_body: With their last-ball defeat against CSK, MI have now recorded the worst-ever start to an IPL season by any team. MI have lost each of their first seven matches in IPL 2022, becoming the first team to lose their first seven matches of an IPL season. DC and RCB had lost their first six matches in 2013 and 2019, respectively.

13.title: Amit Mishra trolls Shahid Afridi after Jadeja drops catch, Dhoni misses stumping
13.article_body: Leg-spinner Amit Mishra trolled former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi after CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja dropped a catch and CSK wicketkeeper MS Dhoni missed a stumping against MI. He wrote, "Jadeja dropping a catch and MSD missing a stumping is like Shahid Afridi batting sensibly with eyes open. No one can believe it happened."

14.title: Ravindra Jadeja bows down to MS Dhoni after win vs MI, pic goes viral
14.article_body: CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja bowed down to MS Dhoni after CSK defeated MI on the last ball in their IPL 2022 encounter on Thursday. Jadeja removed his cap and bowed down to Dhoni when both the teams were greeting each other after the match. Dhoni scored 16 runs off the last four deliveries to help CSK win.

15.title: Mike Tyson repeatedly punches man on flight, leaves him bloodied
15.article_body: A video obtained by TMZ shows Mike Tyson repeatedly punching a fellow passenger on a flight to Florida. Tyson's punches left the man with a bloodied forehead. A statement from Tyson's representatives says the incident involved an "aggressive passenger" who harassed Tyson and "threw a water bottle at him while he was in his seat".

16.title: Thunderstorm hits Hyderabad; flights from Delhi, Mumbai, Bengaluru diverted
16.article_body: Flights coming to Hyderabad from Delhi, Mumbai, Bengaluru and Visakhapatnam were diverted to other cities as the city and suburbs witnessed a thunderstorm on Thursday evening. Parts of Hyderabad and surrounding districts experienced light to moderate rainfall, along with hailstorm and lightning. Strong winds also uprooted trees and disrupted traffic movement at a few areas.

17.title: Man kills elderly man with mirror glass at Pune de-addiction centre
17.article_body: A 24-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly killed a 65-year-old man by hitting the latter's neck with a broken mirror glass at a de-addiction centre in Pune on Thursday. The accused also purportedly put his fingers in the wound to widen it, as per the FIR. A police statement said that the deceased had been reportedly abusing the accused.

18.title: 13-yr-old Mumbai boy choked to death by neighbour for spitting near their house
18.article_body: A 13-year-old boy was allegedly choked to death by his neighbour for spitting near their residence in Mumbai's Nagwadi. The accused, who was later arrested, had allegedly lied to the victim's mother and took him to a secluded place on the pretext of visiting a fair. The minor's body was found at an abandoned toilet.

19.title: 80-yr-old man dies after EV battery being charged in living room explodes in T'gana
19.article_body: An 80-year-old man died and four others in his family sustained burn injuries when the detachable battery of an electric scooter, kept on charge inside their living room in Telangana, exploded. While the police registered a case against the manufacturer Pure EV, the company said it had no record of the sale of this vehicle to the user.

20.title: MS Dhoni smashes 16 runs off last 4 balls as CSK defeat MI on last ball
20.article_body: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) defeated Mumbai Indians (MI) by three wickets to register their second victory in IPL 2022. MS Dhoni slammed 16 runs off the last four deliveries to help CSK chase down the 156-run target on the last ball of the match. MI have now lost their first seven matches in IPL 2022.

21.title: We have reserve stock of 2.23 cr tonnes of coal: Minister to Rahul
21.article_body: Union Power Minister RK Singh hit out at Congress MP Rahul Gandhi, saying India has a reserve stock of 2.23 crore tonnes of coal. "Rahul Gandhi has tweeted that there is a coal crisis. He doesn't have any information," he said. This comes after Rahul Gandhi said that only eight days of coal was left in stock.

22.title: IMF, World Bank not designed to handle global crises: Yellen
22.article_body: The International Monetary Fund and World Bank were not designed to handle multiple crises they're currently dealing with, including Russia's war in Ukraine and the COVID-19 pandemic, US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said on Thursday. She added, "We face challenges that will now require investment on a scale that an international institution can't manage on its own, like climate change."

23.title: MS Dhoni successfully plots Kieron Pollard's dismissal, video goes viral
23.article_body: A video of MI all-rounder Kieron Pollard's dismissal against CSK in their IPL 2022 match on Thursday has gone viral on social media. CSK wicketkeeper MS Dhoni placed Shivam Dube at the straightish long-on position. Pollard was caught by Dube after he smashed a Maheesh Theekshana delivery straight to him. "This is Dhoni's wicket," a fan tweeted.

24.title: I bow at feet of all 10 gurus: PM on Guru Tegh Bahadur's 400th Parkash Purab
24.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, while taking part at the 400th Parkash Purab celebrations of Sri Guru Tegh Bahadur at Red Fort in Delhi, said "I bow at the feet of all 10 gurus." He congratulated people on the occasion. "I am happy that today our country is moving forward with full devotion on the ideals of our gurus," he added.

25.title: Mauritius PM visits Varanasi, offers prayers at Vishwanath Temple
25.article_body: Mauritius Prime Minister Pravind Kumar Jugnauth, who is on an eight-day visit to India, offered prayers at Kashi Vishwanath Temple in Varanasi. On Wednesday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi held a bilateral meeting with Mauritius PM after the inauguration of the Global Ayush Summit. PM Modi and his Mauritius counterpart took part in a roadshow in Ahmedabad on Tuesday.

26.title: Guru Tegh Bahadur became 'Hind di Chadar' in front of Aurangzeb: PM
26.article_body: Addressing the nation from Red Fort on the occasion of the 400th birth anniversary of Guru Tegh Bahadur, PM Narendra Modi said, "In front of Aurangzeb's tyrannical thinking, Guru Tegh Bahadur became 'Hind di Chadar' and stood like a rock." "This Red Fort is a witness that even though Aurangzeb severed many heads, but couldn't shake our faith," he added.

27.title: Russia bans entry of 29 Americans including Zuckerberg, US VP Kamala
27.article_body: Russia on Thursday banned 29 Americans from entering the Russian Federation "indefinitely". The Americans who were banned from entering Russia include Facebook Co-founder Mark Zuckerberg, US Vice President Kamala Harris, Deputy Defence Secretary Kathleen Hicks and Pentagon spokesperson John Kirby and other business leaders, officials and journalists. Russia also barred the entry of 61 Canadians.

28.title: SBI issues warning as customers get calls from 2 numbers, says 'Do not engage with them'
28.article_body: State Bank of India issued warning to its customers about frauds. Noting that customers are getting calls from two numbers, +91-8294710946 and +91-7362951973, SBI tweeted, "Do not engage with these numbers, & don't click on #phishing links...as they aren't associated with SBI." Customers getting calls from the numbers are being asked to click on a phishing link for KYC update.

29.title: India never posed a threat to any country, society: PM Modi at Red Fort
29.article_body: While addressing a gathering to mark the 400th birth anniversary of Guru Tegh Bahadur at Red Fort, PM Narendra Modi said that India has never posed a threat to any country or society. "When we talk about self-reliant India, we keep the progress of the whole world in front of the goal," PM Modi further said.

30.title: PM releases commemorative coin, postage stamp on 400th Parkash Purab
30.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday released a commemorative coin and a postage stamp at Red Fort in Delhi to mark the 400th birth anniversary of Sikh guru Tegh Bahadur. PM Modi also addressed the people from the Red Fort on the occasion. He also took part in 'Shabad Kirtan' held at the Red Fort.

31.title: UP CM orders construction of more jails to resolve overcrowding
31.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has ordered the construction of new jails and more barracks in old jails to solve the issue of overcrowding. He said that sanitary napkins, dispensers and incinerator facility should be available at women's help desk in prisons. "Land should be purchased for the construction of district jails in Amroha, Sambhal, Shamli, and Muzaffarnagar," he added.

32.title: 7-yr-old MP boy with down syndrome hoists tricolour at Everest base camp
32.article_body: A seven-year-old boy, Avneesh, with down syndrome hoisted the tricolour at the Mount Everest base camp with his father. The duo from Madhya Pradesh's Indore trekked with a weight of 70 kg in which 10 kg was only medicines for Avneesh. His father also changed his diet plan while preparing to climb the Mount Everest.

33.title: Pics of Ranveer, Alia from sets of 'Rocky Aur Rani...' surface online
33.article_body: Pictures of Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt from the sets of 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' have been shared by Churni Ganguly. "Elated to share the floor with legends like Dharmendra ji, Jaya Bachchan and Shabana Azmi, and of course, Alia Bhatt and Ranveer Singh," Churni captioned the post. The film is directed by Karan Johar.

34.title: Ethiopians queue up outside Russian Embassy to fight in Ukraine
34.article_body: Hundreds of Ethiopians queued up outside the Russian Embassy in Addis Ababa over the last two weeks to volunteer to fight for Moscow in Ukraine, Reuters reported. The volunteers reportedly arrived at the embassy with their military records after rumours of recruitment for Russian troops surfaced on social media. Russia, however, has not confirmed deploying Ethiopian volunteers to Ukraine.

35.title: Do you need bulldozers to clear stalls, chairs, boxes: SC on Delhi demolition
35.article_body: During the hearing on the anti-encroachment drive in the violence-hit Jahangirpuri area of Delhi, the Supreme Court asked North Delhi Municipal Corporation, "Do you need bulldozers to clear stalls, chairs, tables, and boxes?" This was after Solicitor General Tushar Mehta submitted that there was no provision for notice to remove stalls, chairs and other things from footpaths and roads.

36.title: Tesla robot to be worth more than its self-driving business: Musk
36.article_body: World's richest person and Tesla CEO, Elon Musk, said the company's robot Optimus would eventually be worth more than its full self-driving (FSD) business. "I was surprised that people didn't realise the magnitude of the Optimus robot program," Musk stated during Wednesday's earnings call. Optimus, a 5'8" humanoid robot, was first introduced in August 2021 during Tesla's inaugural AI Day.

37.title: US Prez announces additional $800 million military aide for Ukraine
37.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Thursday announced an additional $800 million in military aid for Ukraine. According to the US President, the new package will include heavy artillery, howitzers, 1,44,000 rounds of ammunition and tactical drones. "We're in a critical window now of time where they're going to set the stage for the next phase of this war," Biden said.

38.title: HD Kumaraswamy asks K'taka CM to call meeting of religious leaders
38.article_body: JD(S) leader and former CM HD Kumaraswamy asked Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai to call a meeting of religious leaders of all communities of the state amid recent communal tensions. Hitting out at BJP and Congress for disturbing peace, he said, "The issue of use of loudspeakers and sound pollution has started now, there was no such issue till now."

39.title: Chhattisgarh roads will be like American roads in 5 years: Gadkari
39.article_body: Union Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari has assured to build roads in Chhattisgarh that will be like the roads in the US over the next five years. "For the growth of any state, strengthening water, transport, power and communication sectors are very important. The balanced development of these four sectors accelerates the agriculture and industry growth," he said.

40.title: HCL Technologies' profit rises 23.9% to ₹3,593 crore in Q4
40.article_body: HCL Technologies on Thursday reported a consolidated net profit of ₹3,593 crore for the quarter ended March 2022, up 23.9% from ₹2,899 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. The company said its revenue from operations increased 15.1% year-on-year to ₹22,597 crore. Further, the board of HCL Technologies has declared an interim dividend of ₹18 per share for the FY2022-23.

41.title: Old pic of Akshay Kumar's cigarette ad surfaces after he says he has not endorsed tobacco
41.article_body: An old cigarette ad featuring Akshay Kumar has resurfaced after the actor stepped back from a pan masala brand's ad following criticism. In a statement posted on social media, Akshay said that he "has not and will not" endorse tobacco. "'While I have not endorsed tobacco'!! Cigarettes are made of gulkand kya?" a Twitter user wrote.

42.title: Cong leader writes to CM Mamata on 'miserable' condition of Muslims in WB
42.article_body: West Bengal Congress chief Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury wrote to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee seeking her attention to the "pathetic and miserable condition of the Muslim minority" in the state. "Despite your government being in power in West Bengal for more than a decade, the minorities are still marginalised, backward and neglected sections of the society," he wrote.

43.title: 2 women labourers among 4 die in lightning strike in Andhra Pradesh
43.article_body: At least four persons, including two women farm labourers, died after they were struck by lightning in Adoni in the Kurnool district of Andhra Pradesh during a spell of rain on Thursday evening. Officials said the two women workers were returning from the fields when they were struck by lightning and died on the spot.

44.title: World no. 11 Alcaraz beats Kwon in opening match at Barcelona Open
44.article_body: World number 11 Carlos Alcaraz on Wednesday beat Soonwoo Kwon 6-1, 2-6, 6-2 in his opening match at the Barcelona Open. The match was Alcaraz's first on home soil since losing to fellow Spaniard Rafael Nadal at the Madrid Open last May. The 18-year-old improved to 19-3 this season as he seeks his third ATP tour title of 2022.

45.title: BMW unveils new all-electric i7 with 'private cinema screen' in the back seat
45.article_body: German carmaker BMW has unveiled its all-electric 2023 BMW i7 sedan. It features what BMW is calling a 'Theatre Screen', a 31.3-inch panoramic display in 32:9 format with 8K resolution which extends downwards from the roof. "The screen transforms the second row of seats into an exclusive private cinema on wheels," BMW said.

46.title: Instagram to downrank TikTok reposts, promote native content
46.article_body: Instagram Head Adam Mosseri has announced the company's plan to downrank Reels videos that are not original to the platform. This means all the reshared content from apps like TikTok will soon be shown less to promote original content. "If you create something from scratch, you should get more credit than if you're resharing something," Mosseri stated.

47.title: Building owned by ex-BJP MLA, who switched to SP, bulldozed in UP
47.article_body: An "illegal" building owned by SP leader Roshan Lal Verma was demolished by the authorities in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur. The former MLA had switched to the SP from BJP ahead of recently-held state Assembly election. The structure was constructed on a government land, District Magistrate Umesh Pratap Singh said.

48.title: CBI files chargesheet against ex-NSE CEO Ramkrishna, Subramanian
48.article_body: CBI has filed its chargesheet against National Stock Exchange's (NSE) ex-MD and CEO Chitra Ramkrishna and ex-Group Operating Officer Anand Subramanian in connection with the co-location scam case. In the chargesheet, CBI has accused Ramkrishna of allegedly abusing her official position in key decisions. SEBI had earlier charged her with alleged governance lapses in Subramanian's appointment.

49.title: 'You told me you'll bat', Rohit tells Jadeja after he opts to bowl first; video goes viral
49.article_body: Mumbai Indians (MI) captain Rohit Sharma's banter with Chennai Super Kings (CSK) captain Ravindra Jadeja after CSK won the toss and elected to bowl first in their IPL 2022 match has gone viral. When Jadeja was making his way back after completing the interview following the toss, Rohit stopped him and said, "Bowling? You told me you will bat."

50.title: PURE EV recalls 2,000 e-scooters after multiple fire incidents
50.article_body: PURE EV has issued a recall of 2,000 of its ETrance Plus and EPluto 7G models in view of fire incidents involving its vehicles in Chennai and Nizamabad. The vehicles and batteries will be thoroughly checked for any imbalance issues, the company said. The dealership network will contact concerned customers while an expeditious campaign will be ensured, PURE EV added.

51.title: Marvel keeps updating storyline of 'Doctor Strange 2': Bruce Campbell
51.article_body: Actor Bruce Campbell said Marvel keeps updating the storyline of 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness'. "Sam [Raimi, director]...had to add scenes that [Marvel] told him he had to shoot...he's removed scenes that no longer apply," Bruce said. "Until May rolls around I don't think Benedict Cumberbatch even knows if he's in this movie or not," he added.

52.title: No cap on Ukrainian refugees despite accomodation problems: Ireland
52.article_body: Ireland won't cap the number of Ukrainian refugees it accepts despite the government's current challenges in housing them, Irish Justice Minister Helen McEntee said on Thursday. McEntee stated that she'd support plans to financially help households that take in Ukrainian refugees. An estimated 25,000 Ukrainians have arrived in Ireland since the Russian invasion of Ukraine began on February 24.

53.title: Free COVID vaccine precaution dose for all above 18 years at govt centres in Delhi
53.article_body: Delhi government on Thursday announced that the precaution dose of COVID-19 vaccine will be free for all eligible beneficiaries aged above 18 in government vaccination centres with immediate effect. The precaution dose was already free for healthcare workers and those aged above 60. The provision of paid booster dose in private vaccination centres will also continue, an official order said.

54.title: 10 people killed in mosque blast in Afghanistan; ISIS claims responsibility
54.article_body: At least 10 people were killed and over 50 people were injured in a blast at a Shiite mosque in the northern Afghanistan city of Mazar-e-Sharif on Thursday, according to reports. The Islamic State (ISIS) has reportedly claimed responsibility for the mosque blast. Separately, at least four people were killed in another blast that hit Afghanistan's Kunduz city on Thursday.

55.title: I had faith I'd witness this day: Yash on 'KGF 2' success
55.article_body: Yash, taking to Instagram, thanked his fans for showing love towards 'KGF: Chapter 2'. He shared a story on faith and said, "There was a small village...facing a situation of drought...villagers decided to have a prayer meet." "There was one boy...turned up with an umbrella...that was faith. I'm like that...boy who had the faith of witnessing this day," he added.

56.title: Man City beat Brighton 3-0 to regain 1 point lead over Liverpool in PL
56.article_body: Manchester City on Wednesday beat Brighton 3-0 to regain top spot on the Premier League table and a one point lead over rivals Liverpool. Riyad Mahrez, Phil Foden and Bernardo Silva scored for City. Liverpool had taken a two-point lead over Manchester City on Tuesday after beating Manchester United 4-0. City now have 77 points from 32 games this season.

57.title: Sonia Gandhi keen on a united Congress in Rajasthan: Sachin Pilot
57.article_body: Ex-Rajasthan Deputy CM and Congress leader Sachin Pilot, who met party chief Sonia Gandhi in Delhi on Thursday, said that Gandhi is "very keen" on a united performance by the party for upcoming state Assembly elections. Pilot added that they also discussed organisational polls and party strengthening strategies. Rajasthan is set to go to the polls in 2023.

58.title: Dwayne Bravo touches Kieron Pollard's feet ahead of CSK-MI match, video viral
58.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing CSK all-rounder Dwayne Bravo touching his compatriot and MI all-rounder Kieron Pollard's feet ahead of their IPL 2022 match on Thursday. Pollard on Wednesday announced his retirement from international cricket. MI are currently last on the IPL 2022 points table, while CSK are ninth.

59.title: Elon Musk secures $46.5 billion in funding to buy Twitter
59.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk has said a $46.5 billion financing is lined up to acquire Twitter and he is considering starting a tender offer for its outstanding shares. Musk said Morgan Stanley and other financial institutions have committed around $25.5 billion in debt financing. "Almost $21 billion comes from Musk's own pocket through equity financing," Bloomberg reported.

60.title: Hunters pose with 8-ft tusks after killing one of the biggest elephants in Botswana
60.article_body: Pictures showing trophy hunters posing with one of the biggest elephants in Botswana after killing it have surfaced. A photo showed a hunter holding its nearly eight-foot tusks. Criticising the country's move of reversing its decision to ban hunting, Botswana's former President Ian Khama said, "An elephant that tour operators constantly tried to show tourists as an iconic attraction...is dead."

61.title: Bukayo Saka's penalty strike helps Arsenal beat Chelsea 4-2 in PL
61.article_body: Bukayo Saka on Wednesday scored from the penalty spot in the 92nd minute to help Arsenal beat Chelsea 4-2 in the Premier League. With six games left to play this season, Arsenal are currently fifth on the table and level on points with Tottenham Hotspur in fourth place with 57 points. Arsenal's Eddie Nketiah scored twice in the game.

62.title: 'Spider-Man: Across The Spider-Verse' release postponed to June 2, 2023
62.article_body: 'Spider-Man: Across The Spider-Verse', which was initially slated to release on October 7 this year, has been postponed to June 2, 2023. The film is a sequel to the 2018 film 'Spider-Man: Into the Spider-verse'. Dakota Johnson and Sydney Sweeney-starrer 'Madame Web', a spin-off of 'Spider-Man', will release on July 7, 2023.

63.title: If we win all our games we will be champions: Man City's Pep Guardiola
63.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola said his side is "not stupid" and know they must win all their remaining matches to win the Premier League title this season. City are currently one point ahead of Liverpool with six games left to play. "If we draw, drop just two points, Liverpool will be champions," Guardiola said.

64.title: 'Appeasement politics' in J'khand to blame for pro-Pak slogans: BJP leader
64.article_body: BJP leader Deepak Prakash alleged that "politics of appeasement" in Jharkhand is responsible for alleged pro-Pakistan slogans that were raised in Giridih on Thursday. "Since Hemant Soren’s government...[came] to power, there's been a continuous gathering of anti-national forces," he said. At least 10 persons were booked for shouting the slogans during nomination filing process for Panchayat polls.

65.title: New Pak govt to place members of Imran Khan cabinet on no-fly list
65.article_body: PM Shehbaz Sharif-led newly-elected Pakistan government has decided to place members of former PM Imran Khan's cabinet on the no-fly list, ANI reported. They reportedly believe the ministers of the former government would possibly flee with "corruption money" which they had collected during their regime. Notably, Khan was removed as Pakistan PM after he lost the no-trust vote against him.

66.title: Vote for BJP if you want criminals to come to power: Delhi CM Kejriwal
66.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday told the people of Karnataka to vote for BJP if they wanted criminals to come to power in the state. "But if you want better schools, vote for the AAP. If you want hooligans, vote for them, but if you want hospitals, vote for Kejriwal," he further said.

67.title: Pic shows mysterious woman with Kim Jong-un, speculated to be his half sister
67.article_body: A mysterious woman has been spotted with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un at several events recently amid speculations that she's his half sister Kim Sol-song. The woman has also been seen handing him his speech at a large political rally in February. "This woman might be his private secretary," expert on North Korea's elite Michael Madden suggested.

68.title: Considered sacrilege for woman to date younger man: Malaika on dating Arjun
68.article_body: Malaika Arora, speaking about the 12-year gap between her and her boyfriend Arjun Kapoor, has said, "It's often considered a sacrilege for a woman to date a younger man." She called it a "misogynist" approach to female relationships. Malaika shared her mother's teaching and said, "She always told me to live life on my terms and be independent."

69.title: Vidyut Jammwal-starrer 'Khuda Haafiz 2' to release on June 17
69.article_body: Actor Vidyut Jammwal's upcoming film 'Khuda Haafiz: Chapter 2 Agni Pariksha' will receive a theatrical release on June 17. "Witness the #AgniPariksha of Sameer & Nargis in #KhudaHaafizChapterllAgniPariksha. Releasing in theatres on June 17, 2022," Vidyut wrote on Instagram. The film will also feature Shivaleeka Oberoi. The film is a sequel to the 2020 film 'Khuda Haafiz'.

70.title: Aus Oppn leader tests COVID-19 positive while campaigning for polls
70.article_body: Australian Opposition leader Anthony Albanese said on Thursday that he has tested positive for COVID-19 ahead of the May 21 federal elections. The 59-year-old politician from the Labor Party said that he will quarantine for a week at his residence in Sydney. Notably, his political opponent and Australian PM Scott Morrison had also tested positive for the virus last month.

71.title: Pic of Hardik Pandya's lookalike dancing at Coachella goes viral, Twitter users react
71.article_body: A tweet has recently gone viral where a Twitter user has compared a background dancer, who was performing with rapper Doja Cat at the Coachella Music Festival, with cricketer Hardik Pandya. "Now we know why he missed GT's previous match," a Twitter user jokingly commented. "Hardik Pandya rehearsing for IPL closing ceremony," another comment read.

72.title: Rohit Sharma records most ducks in IPL history
72.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma got out for a two-ball duck against CSK on Thursday. Rohit has now been dismissed for a duck in IPL 14 times, which is the most number of ducks for any batter. He overtook Harbhajan Singh, Piyush Chawla, Mandeep Singh, Parthiv Patel, Ajinkya Rahane and Ambati Rayudu, who have recorded 13 ducks each.

73.title: Goenka lists 5 reasons for low IPL TV ratings, says 'Virat, Dhoni haven't fired yet'
73.article_body: RPG Enterprises Chairman Harsh Goenka took to Twitter to list five reasons why "IPL TV ratings are down". "The crowd favourites MI and CSK playing poor and heroes like Virat, Dhoni, Rohit haven't fired yet," were among the reasons he listed. When filmmaker Pritish Nandy tweeted, "The product is slowly tiring," Goenka responded, "I think that's the real answer."

74.title: Navya edits her Instagram post after it sparks dating rumours with Siddhant
74.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda has made changes to her recent Instagram post's caption after it sparked rumours that she is dating actor Siddhant Chaturvedi. She reportedly also deleted a comment that she had made on one of Siddhant's pictures. Siddhant had posted a picture from the hilltop, on which Navya had commented a smiling sun emoji.

75.title: AAP will form govt in K'taka like it did in Delhi, Punjab: Kejriwal
75.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal said his party will form the government in Karnataka just like it did in Delhi and Punjab. The previous Congress government in Karnataka was called "20% commission government" and the current BJP government is called "40% commission government", Kejriwal said. "Delhi has 0% commission government because there's a hardcore honest government," he added.

76.title: Negligent firms will be penalised: Gadkari on EV fire incidents
76.article_body: Electric vehicle (EV) firms found to be negligent in their processes will be heavily penalised, Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said while referring to incidents of EVs catching fire. He added that the Centre has constituted a committee to enquire into these incidents. Based on the committee's findings, the government will issue necessary orders on defaulting companies, Gadkari added.

77.title: CSK to bowl first against MI, 2 players making their debut for MI
77.article_body: CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja won the toss and elected to bowl first against MI in their IPL 2022 clash at DY Patil Stadium in Mumbai. Pacer Riley Meredith and off-spinner Hrithik Shokeen are making their debut for MI. CSK have made two changes to their playing XI, with Dwaine Pretorius and Mitchell Santner replacing Chris Jordan and Moeen Ali, respectively.

78.title: Maternal deaths have tripled in Lebanon amid economic crisis: UNICEF
78.article_body: Number of women dying due to pregnancy-related complications has nearly tripled in Lebanon amid its economic turmoil, UNICEF said on Wednesday. UNICEF stated that one-third of children couldn't access healthcare in the country until October last year, adding that neonatal fatalities there have also increased. Roughly 40% of doctors have left Lebanon after it plunged into economic crisis in 2019.

79.title: BMC increases efforts as Mumbai accounts for half of Maha Covid cases
79.article_body: With over half of Maharashtra's Covid-19 cases being reported from maximum city Mumbai, the city's civic body BMC has asked civic officials to increase daily testing and ensure strict contact-tracing. "We have directed officials to increase testing, surveillance, contact tracing, strict implementation of home isolation protocol and booster dose to the eligible population," a BMC official said.

80.title: 'I don't know, who is he?': Assam CM on Jignesh Mevani's arrest
80.article_body: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma claimed ignorance on Thursday when asked about Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani, who was arrested on Wednesday night in connection with allegedly offensive tweets about PM Narendra Modi. "I don't know. Who is he? I'm not aware of the specifics. Who will do vendetta politics when I don't know him?" he said.

81.title: ITC to acquire 10% stake in Blupin Technologies for ₹39 cr
81.article_body: ITC on Thursday announced that it will acquire 10.7% stake in Blupin Technologies for up to ₹39.34 crore. Blupin Technologies is a web and app-based content-to-community-to-commerce platform that offers mother and baby care products and services under the brand 'Mylo'. The investment will provide the company an early mover advantage and an expanded presence in the D2C space, ITC said.

82.title: UK PM Boris Johnson visits Akshardham Temple in Gujarat
82.article_body: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson visited the Akshardham Temple in Gujarat's Gandhinagar on Thursday. He arrived in Ahmedabad on Thursday morning on a two-day visit to India. Earlier in the day, he visited the Sabarmati Ashram in Ahmedabad and tried his hands on a charkha. He is the first UK PM to visit Gujarat.

83.title: Don't lecture the judiciary: SC to Home Ministry on Abu Salem case
83.article_body: Supreme Court on Thursday rejected the Centre's stand that gangster Abu Salem's petition against his jail sentence exceeding 25 years is premature. It told the Home Ministry, "Don't lecture...judiciary. We don't take it kindly when you tell us to decide something which you have to decide." It added, "The Home Secretary is nobody to tell us to decide the issue."

84.title: Shooting of 'Fast & Furious 10' begins, Vin Diesel shares film's logo
84.article_body: The shooting of Vin Diesel-starrer 'Fast and Furious 10' has started. Vin took to Instagram on Wednesday to share the logo of the film that read, "Fast X". The actor captioned the post, "Day one." The film will also feature Charlize Theron, Tyrese Gibson, Ludacris, Michelle Rodriguez, Sung Kang, Jason Momoa, Daniela Melchior and Brie Larson.

85.title: PM gave me certificate of 'imandaar' CM: Arvind Kejriwal
85.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday claimed that PM Narendra Modi had given him the "certificate of imandaar (honest) CM". "PM made the CBI raid my residence. Officials entered my bedroom but they couldn't find anything. Eventually, PM gave me the certificate of 'imandaar' CM. Ours is an honest government," Kejriwal added.

86.title: Man accused of rape injured in police firing while trying to escape
86.article_body: A rape accused was injured in firing when he allegedly tried to escape from custody in Assam's Nagaon. Police said that he tried to escape when he was taken to the hospital after he complained of chest pain. When he refused to stop even after repeated warnings, police had to fire and he was hit on the leg, police added.

87.title: 10 persons booked for shouting Pro-Pakistan slogans in Jharkhand
87.article_body: At least ten persons were booked in connection with a video that showed pro-Pakistan slogans being raised in Giridih, Jharkhand. The incident reportedly took place during a nomination filing procession for the Panchayat elections. "Mukhiya candidate Mohammad Shakir's supporters were sloganeering near block office gate... pro-Pakistan slogans were raised," sub-divisional police officer said.

88.title: UK announces new sanctions against Russia over its Ukraine invasion
88.article_body: UK on Thursday announced new sanctions against Russia in response to its Ukraine's invasion. The country added 26 new designations to its list of sanctions against Russia, which include the Russian army's Colonel General Nikolay Bogdanovsky, who holds the position of First Deputy Chief of the General Staff, and defence companies. Earlier, UK imposed sanctions on Russian President Vladimir Putin.

89.title: Peter Schmeichel, Ian Wright among 6 new inductees into PL Hall of Fame
89.article_body: The Premier League on Thursday said Manchester United's former goalkeeper Peter Schmeichel and former Arsenal striker Ian Wright are among six new inductees into its Hall of Fame. Manchester City's Sergio Aguero and Vincent Kompany along with Chelsea's Didier Drogba and Manchester United's Paul Scholes are the other four inductees. Schmeichel won five Premier League titles with Manchester United.

90.title: YouTuber purposely crashed his plane so he could record a video, says US govt body
90.article_body: Federal Aviation Administration has found that Trevor Jacob, a YouTuber who posted a video of himself parachuting out of a plane that he claimed had malfunctioned, purposely abandoned it and allowed it to crash in Southern California. FAA will immediately revoke Jacob's private pilot certificate. Experts had earlier expressed doubts, claiming the video was orchestrated for views and likes.

91.title: BSF officer shoots himself in Tripura's Dhalai
91.article_body: A Border Security Force (BSF) officer allegedly died by suicide after shooting himself outside his battalion headquarters in Dhalai, Tripura. "Prima facie it appeared that the officer shot himself with his service revolver. We have registered a case of unnatural death to find out what had led to the fatal incident," Dhalai SP Ramesh Yadav said.

92.title: 'My son had fractures, 16 stitches due to fault in Ola scooter', says father; firm denies
92.article_body: A father claimed that his son had an accident after Ola Electric's Ola S1 Pro scooter accelerated on a speed breaker instead of slowing. "The scooter went airborne...crashing and skidding...He had fractures in left hand and 16 stitches in right hand," Twitter user Balwant Singh tweeted. Ola Electric responded, "There's no issue with the scooter...we advise you to...please ride safely."

93.title: If I had got injured, I would have been angry: Curran on missing IPL 2022
93.article_body: Talking about missing IPL 2022 due to a lower back injury, ex-CSK all-rounder Sam Curran said, "The advice was for my back to heal properly. If I had gone and got injured, I would have been angry at myself." "I was gutted not to [play in]...IPL 2022. It was hard to take but...the sensible thing to do," added Curran.

94.title: Delhi Police arrests 104, recover 69kg of drugs in last 24 hrs
94.article_body: Delhi Police arrested 104 persons for robbery, snatching, liquor smuggling and recovered 69 kilograms of narcotics substances in the last 24 hours, according to data released by their official Twitter account. Moreover, Delhi Police arrested 15 proclaimed offenders, seized 815 litres of illicit liquor and recovered 20 stolen vehicles. Emergency help was given on 5,607 calls, the post added.

95.title: India willing to increase Brazilian oil imports many times over: Puri
95.article_body: Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Thursday said India is willing to increase crude oil imports from Brazil "many times over" under "long-term special contracts". After meeting with Brazilian Energy Minister Bento Albuquerque, Puri said that Indian companies will also be looking at boosting investment in Brazil. Albuquerque said Brazil is willing to meet India's increased demand for oil.

96.title: Will co-create defence, aerospace tech: Adani after meeting UK PM
96.article_body: India's richest person Gautam Adani on Thursday said the Adani Group will work with companies from the UK to "co-create defence and aerospace technologies" as part of the Indian government's Aatmanirbhar Bharat initiative. This comes after Adani met with UK PM Boris Johnson in Gujarat. Johnson and Adani focused their discussions on key issues like energy transition and climate action.

97.title: Admissions to PG courses will soon be done through CUET: UGC Chairman
97.article_body: Admissions to postgraduate courses will soon be conducted through the Common University Entrance Test (CUET), M Jagadesh Kumar, Chairman of the University Grants Commission said on Thursday. "We are internally discussing conducting CUET twice a year so that the students who could not appear for it the first time can do so in the second chance," he said.

98.title: Woman booked for trying to extort ₹5 crore from Maha Minister
98.article_body: An FIR was registered against a woman who allegedly tried to extort ₹5 crore from Maharashtra Social Justice Minister Dhananjay Munde. Police officials said that the woman called him from international mobile numbers, demanding a shop and an expensive mobile phone. She threatened to defame him on social media if he did not accept her demands, the police added.

99.title: Over 20 cr unused COVID-19 vaccines available with States, UTs: Centre
99.article_body: Over 20.16 crore balance and unutilised COVID-19 vaccine doses are still available with states and Union Territories (UTs) to be administered, informed the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare in its official statement on Thursday. The Union Government is committed to accelerating the pace and expanding the scope of COVID-19 vaccination throughout the country, said the Ministry.

100.title: Man Utd would be battling relegation without Ronaldo: Piers Morgan
100.article_body: Reacting to Manchester United's 0-4 loss against Liverpool, British broadcaster Piers Morgan tweeted, "United would be facing a relegation battle without Cristiano Ronaldo this season in the Premier League." "Abysmal performance," added Morgan in his tweet. Ronaldo has scored 15 goals in 26 Premier League games so far this season. Manchester United are currently sixth on the points table.

101.title: 2 sisters, tortured by dad, rescued from child marriage bid in Indore
101.article_body: Authorities in Madhya Pradesh's Indore district rescued two sisters, aged 15 and 17, who were allegedly being forced to get married, an official said on Thursday. The girls were being compelled to marry two youths from Dewas district, official added. The girls also alleged that their father often tortured them in an inebriated state and had tried to kill them.

102.title: Indians can now use BHIM UPI to make payments in UAE
102.article_body: BHIM UPI is now live at NeoPay terminals across the UAE and can be used by Indian tourists to pay for their purchases at shops and merchant stores, the international arm of NPCI announced. The partnership between NPCI International Payments Ltd and NeoPay was announced last year. Notably, Indians can already use UPI in countries like Bhutan and Singapore.

103.title: We will name Shivamogga airport after BS Yediyurappa: K'taka CM
103.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai announced that the under-construction airport in Shivamogga, Karnataka, will be named after former state CM BS Yediyurappa. He said that the state government has taken a decision in this regard and will send the proposal to civil aviation ministry. "It would give a big boost for education, health services and industrialisation of Shivamogga," Bommai added.

104.title: ₹500 fine for not wearing masks in Gurugram, 3 other Haryana districts: CM
104.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Thursday said a fine of ₹500 will be imposed for not wearing face masks in Gurugram, Faridabad, Sonipat and Jhajjar districts of the state. He said authorities in these four districts have been directed to keep a vigil on COVID-19 situation. The state had earlier lifted the mandate of wearing masks on April 2.

105.title: We intend to deliver more weapons: Danish PM on visit to Kyiv
105.article_body: Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen on Thursday pledged to deliver more weapons to Ukraine after visiting the capital Kyiv with Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez. Frederiksen and Sanchez are in Kyiv to meet with President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in a gesture of support. "We intend to deliver more weapons to Ukraine because that is what is most needed," Frederiksen said.

106.title: Sainz signs 2-year contract extension to remain at Ferrari until 2024
106.article_body: Carlos Sainz has signed a new two-year contract keeping him at Ferrari until the end of 2024. "I have always said that there is no better Formula One team to race for and after over a year with them, I can confirm that putting on this race suit and representing this team is unique and incomparable," Sainz said.

107.title: India criticises US politician, says 'She visited part of J&K illegally occupied by Pak'
107.article_body: India's External Affairs Ministry criticised US Congresswoman Ilhan Omar, who was on a visit to Pakistan, saying, "She has visited a part of...J&K that's currently illegally occupied by Pakistan." Calling it condemnable, MEA said, "If such a politician wishes to practise her narrow-minded politics at home that may be her business, but violating our territorial integrity...makes this ours."

108.title: Was in shock, there was too much blood: Malaika on her car accident
108.article_body: Malaika Arora, in a recent interview, opened up about her car accident that took place at the Mumbai-Pune expressway earlier this month. "Physically, I am recovering, but mentally, I feel that it doesn't go away completely," she stated. Describing her accident, Malaika said, "I was in shock...I wanted to know...whether I was alive or not. There was too much blood."

109.title: Mumbai man stopped from kissing woman, spits on policeman
109.article_body: A 27-year-old man from Mumbai was booked after he allegedly manhandled and spat on a police constable, who confronted him for kissing and hugging a woman at Vasai railway station. "He abused and threatened me and spat on my face twice and caught my collar," the constable said in his complaint. The accused is not arrested yet, the police added.

110.title: Hyd constable harasses, extorts ₹30,000 from 2 people, dismissed
110.article_body: A constable in Hyderabad, Akash Bhatt was dismissed from service for harassing and extorting ₹30,000 from two people. While patrolling on April 15, the constable spotted two people and demanded ₹15,000 and let them go after taking their phone numbers, reports said. Bhatt, however, continued to harass them over the phone and took another ₹15,000.

111.title: Sir David Attenborough named ‘Champion of the Earth’ by UN
111.article_body: The United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) has presented Sir David Attenborough with the Champions of the Earth Lifetime Achievement Award.  The award recognizes Attenborough's "outsized impact on the global environmental movement". "We know what the problems are and we know how to solve them. What we lack is unified action," the 95-year-old naturalist said.

112.title: Govt to decide LIC IPO timing within this week: Official
112.article_body: The government would decide the timing of LIC IPO, initially planned for in March, within this week, a senior official told PTI. It'd be tough to decide whether to go ahead with the retail and domestic investor demand or wait for FIIs, the official added. Notably, if the IPO is not launched by May 12, it'd be deferred till August-September.

113.title: Wisden unveils its 10 best cricket images of 2021
113.article_body: Wisden has unveiled its 10 best cricket images of 2021. An image of England's Jos Buttler jumping over Australia's Steve Smith during England's win against eventual champions Australia at T20 World Cup 2021 has been named Wisden Photograph of 2021. The top 10 images include photographs of Jasprit Bumrah warming up and Joe Root expressing disappointment on dismissal, among others.

114.title: What are the features of the world's 'most powerful missile' tested by Russia?
114.article_body: Russia has successfully tested the Sarmat intercontinental ballistic missile, which Russia's Defence Ministry called the world's "most powerful missile". It weighs more than 200 tonnes and is able to transport multiple warheads. As per Russian media, Sarmat is a three-stage, liquid-fueled missile with a range of 18,000 km. It has been designed to elude anti-missile defence systems.

115.title: Reports of my husband being gay are so silly: Hugh Jackman's wife
115.article_body: Actor Hugh Jackman's wife Deborra-Lee Furness has denied the reports that Hugh is a gay man still in the closet. "It's so silly...It just amazes me that these magazines continue to get away with it," Furness added. "If he was gay, he could be gay. He didn't have to hide in the closet anymore," the Australian actress further said.

116.title: 9 bodies found outside Kyiv, some show signs of torture: Ukraine
116.article_body: Andriy Niebytov, the police chief in Ukraine's Kyiv region, has said the bodies of nine civilians have been found in the town of Borodyanka. He said, "These people were killed by the occupiers and some show signs of torture. The Russian military knowingly shot civilians who didn't put up any resistance." Niebytov added police had discovered two graves around Borodyanka.

117.title: No oil spills on Gultekdi flyover, beware of rumours: PMC to people
117.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has refuted claims of oil spills causing accidents on city's Gultekdi flyover, terming the reports as "fake". Taking to Twitter, PMC stated that a fire brigade vehicle had been sent to location, which found no oil spills in the area. "We request citizens to not believe in any rumours being spread on social media," PMC tweeted.

118.title: Abhishek Bachchan is very humble & supportive: 'Dasvi' co-star Arun
118.article_body: 'Dasvi' actor Arun Kushwah, speaking about his film's co-star Abhishek Bachchan, has said, "Abhishek sir is a great company, very humble and supportive." Arun further stated that he and Abhishek never had a boring moment together. "I also believe that you get to learn a lot when you work with experienced individuals," he added. The film also featured Yami Gautam.

119.title: UK PM climbs onto a bulldozer at JCB factory in Gujarat; video surfaces
119.article_body: A video showing UK PM Boris Johnson climbing onto a bulldozer at JCB's new factory and waving during his visit to Gujarat's Panchmahal has surfaced online. Johnson was visiting the factory with Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel on Thursday. He also met business tycoon Gautam Adani, who tweeted, "Honoured to host Boris Johnson, the first UK PM to visit Gujarat."

120.title: India's richest person Adani hosts UK PM Boris Johnson in Gujarat; shares pic
120.article_body: Gautam Adani, India's richest person and the world's sixth-richest person with $117 billion wealth, hosted UK's PM Boris Johnson on Thursday at the Adani Group headquarters in Gujarat. Johnson, who's on a two-day visit to India, is the first UK PM to visit Gujarat. Adani tweeted that he was "honoured" to host the UK PM.

121.title: No taboos for us: Germany's Baerbock on providing weapons to Ukraine
121.article_body: Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock said there are "no taboos" in Germany supplying armoured vehicles and weapons to Ukraine as Russia's invasion of the country continues. She added that Germany's priority was to quickly provide Ukraine with Soviet-designed kit that its military could use without requiring any extra training. "We know that everyday counts," Baerbock said.

122.title: Adani JV among 14 firms chosen under ₹120 crore-drone PLI scheme
122.article_body: Fourteen drone companies, including Adani's joint venture company with Israel's Elbit, and ideaForge Technology, have been selected as beneficiaries of a production-linked incentive (PLI) scheme, the Aviation Ministry stated. The PLI, worth ₹120 crore, is aimed at boosting drone manufacturing in India. The firms will be given 20% of the "value addition" made by them in the next three years.

123.title: Odisha Dalit man forced to rub nose in spit for refusing ₹500 temple donation
123.article_body: A 32-year-old Dalit man was allegedly forced to rub his nose in his own spit for refusing to donate ₹500 for a temple renovation work in Odisha's Kendrapara, police said. His wife alleged that the village sarpanch abused the couple for refusing to give the donation. The sarpanch, who dismissed the allegations, has been booked along with three others.

124.title: NTPC to use Delhi's sludge to produce environment-friendly energy
124.article_body: National Thermal Power Corporation (NTPC) will use the sludge produced in Delhi Jal Board's sewage treatment plants (STPs) to produce energy in an environment-friendly manner, a statement said. Using sludge to produce energy will reduce net carbon dioxide emissions and control water and land pollution, the statement added. NTPC aims to produce 60GW of energy through renewable sources by 2032.

125.title: Chinese Defence Minister warns US, says 'don't underestimate China'
125.article_body: Chinese National Defence Minister Wei Fenghe held a telephonic conversation with US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin and exchanged views on issues like maritime and air security and the Ukraine situation. During the conversation, Wei reportedly warned the US "not to underestimate China's determination and capability". China hopes to establish stable major-country relations with the US, he added.

126.title: Russia has warned Mariupol residents to wear white ribbon or get shot: Ukraine
126.article_body: The Russian forces in the besieged city of Mariupol, Ukraine, have threatened to shoot civilians if they don't wear white ribbons, Petro Andriushchenko, advisor to the Mayor of Mariupol, said. The white ribbon is believed to be a symbol for Russian troops to identify Ukrainians who've accepted defeat. Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday claimed to have "successfully liberated" Mariupol.

127.title: WhatsApp planning paid multi-device support for businesses: Report
127.article_body: WhatsApp is working on a paid subscription plan for WhatsApp Business, which will allow users to connect up to 10 devices to a single WhatsApp account, WaBetaInfo reported. This will allow multiple employees to access the same account on their phones. Currently, users can connect four additional devices for free, both on WhatsApp and WhatsApp Business.

128.title: Man with degree to check specs number treats UP woman, she goes blind
128.article_body: A woman was rendered blind after a man, Kuldeep, who has degree only for checking number of glasses worn by people, treated her at a "fake eye clinic". The victim, Prema Devi, had visited Kuldeep's clinic on April 5. Kuldeep had given her some eye-drops. Her son said that his mother lost her eyesight three days after receiving the medicine.

129.title: Pay ₹2,000 fine for taking selfies on railway tracks: Southern Railway
129.article_body: Chennai division of Southern Railway will levy a fine of ₹2,000 on individuals caught taking selfies on railway tracks or near locomotives. Additionally, people caught travelling on footboards will be punished with either a prison term of up to three months or a ₹500 fine. The move comes weeks after an accident on railway tracks in Chengalpattu claimed three lives.

130.title: Will follow SC order on Jahangirpuri but drive to continue: NDMC Mayor
130.article_body: The North Delhi Municipal Corporation will follow the Supreme Court's order and not conduct the anti-encroachment drive in Jahangirpuri, the civic body's Mayor Raja Iqbal Singh said on Thursday. "I also want to clarify that the civic body will keep taking action against encroachers. We will identify illegal encroachments and send notices to them and take action," Singh said.

131.title: CSK's Chris Jordan has conceded runs as if they were on sale: Harbhajan
131.article_body: Sharing his opinion on the performances of CSK pacer Chris Jordan who conceded 58 runs in the franchise's last IPL 2022 match against GT, Harbhajan Singh said Jordan has conceded runs as if they were "on sale". "Jordan needs to sit back and think about his own game," added Harbhajan. CSK will take on MI today.

132.title: AAP politicising police: Sidhu after Punjab Police book Kumar Vishwas
132.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu on Thursday said the AAP government is politicising the police force to use it for their own interests and to target those who raise their voice against AAP's Arvind Kejriwal. This comes after Punjab Police booked Kumar Vishwas over "inflammatory statements" against Kejriwal. "Punjab's CM has become a 'rubber da gudda' (rubber doll)," Sidhu added.

133.title: Filled with pride for my powerhouse bhaijaan: Ishaan praises Shahid for Jersey
133.article_body: Actor Ishaan Khatter took to Instagram to praise actor Shahid Kapoor for his recently released film 'Jersey'. Sharing his review for the movie, Ishaan wrote, "As a brother, I'm filled with pride, as an actor with respect and as an audience with admiration for my powerhouse bhaijaan @ShahidKapoor. Thank you for sharing what you did through this character."

134.title: German Finance Minister tests positive for COVID-19 during US trip
134.article_body: German Finance Minister Christian Lindner on Wednesday said he tested positive for COVID-19 after his appointments with the International Monetary Fund and the G20 in Washington. Lindner added that due to having taken three vaccinations he was experiencing "only mild and already fading cold symptoms". Lindner, 43, had more appointments scheduled on Thursday in the US before returning to Germany.

135.title: I am not sure how relevant MI-CSK rivalry is in IPL 2022: Harbhajan
135.article_body: Discussing the upcoming match between MI and CSK, ex-India spinner Harbhajan Singh said he is not sure how "relevant" their rivalry is in IPL 2022. "The franchises that were in the top two are now in bottom two," added Harbhajan. "This match was like India versus Pakistan in terms of rivalry," stated Harbhajan. Harbhajan represented both franchises during his career.

136.title: Mumbai's Khar subway to remain closed for repair works till May 2
136.article_body: The Khar Golibar subway will remain closed between 10:00 pm and 5:00 am till May 2 for urgent repair works. The subway will be closed for vehicular traffic and pedestrians coming from Vakola Junction, Santacruz station and Golibar road towards Santacruz West, the Western Railway said. Vehicles will be diverted from Agripada slip road to Milan Subway.

137.title: 2 farmers killed, 1 injured after being attacked by wild bear in Jharkhand
137.article_body: Two farmers died while another suffered serious injuries when a wild bear attacked them in Jharkhand's Gumla district on Thursday. According to police, the farmers were ploughing their paddy field at Ambera Nagesiatoli village when an adult wild bear attacked them. While 56-year-old Lalit Kishan died on the spot, Subhash Kishan and Mangleshwar Kishan sustained injuries, police added.

138.title: Still can't believe you're gone: Actress Akshara Gowda on her mother's demise
138.article_body: Actress Akshara Gowda mourned the loss of her mother who passed away on April 12. Taking to Instagram, she shared a post for her and wrote, "The worst part about the death of someone you love is...you can't die with them (I so wish I can)...I still can't believe you are gone...I hope I'll make you proud."

139.title: Amid threats, Dalit bridegroom rides a horse under police protection in MP
139.article_body: Amid threats, a Dalit bridegroom rode a horse for his marriage ritual under police protection in Madhya Pradesh's Damoh district. He was allegedly threatened by the upper-caste villagers with consequences if he did so, police said. Eleven people were also put under preventive arrest, police added. The 22-year-old groom had posted a video seeking help on social media.

140.title: Fire breaks out in building in Mumbai's Khar; 8 fire tenders douse blaze
140.article_body: A level-2 fire broke out on the fourth floor of the seven-storey Notan Villa building in Mumbai's Khar on Thursday morning, a civic official said. At least eight fire engines, water tankers, ambulances and other fire-fighting equipment reached the spot and four people were rescued from the building's terrace, officials said. The fire has now been doused.

141.title: US' Arizona wildfire gets 3 times bigger, thousands forced to evacuate
141.article_body: A wildfire in US' Arizona, dubbed as Tunnel Fire, is said to have grown three times in size as it spread over thousands of acres, burning down dozens of structures. Thousands of residents were forced to leave their homes in the affected areas. The fire swept largely unpopulated hills and valleys about 23 km north of Flagstaff, said the authorities.

142.title: At least 10 people test positive for COVID-19 at IIT Madras
142.article_body: At least 10 people have tested positive for COVID-19 at IIT Madras, officials said on Thursday. This comes amid spike in COVID-19 cases in several parts of India. Tamil Nadu, on Wednesday reported 31 new COVID-19 cases. Meanwhile, India saw 2,380 COVID-19 cases and 56 COVID-19 induced deaths in last 24 hours. Active cases in India stand at 13,433.

143.title: Man cooks & eats body parts of his neighbour; declared fit for trial in US
143.article_body: A 40-year-old man who allegedly cooked and ate his neighbour's body parts after killing him last year has been declared sane and fit for trial by psychiatrists in US' Idaho. The accused was involuntarily committed to the Idaho Security Medical Program in October. He will be presented in a magistrate court on Friday, according to reports.

144.title: Wisden names its 5 cricketers of the year, 2 Indians included
144.article_body: Wisden named its five cricketers of the year in the 2022 edition of the Wisden Almanack. The 'Wisden Cricketers of the Year' are India pacer Jasprit Bumrah, India captain Rohit Sharma, New Zealand batter Devon Conway, England fast bowler Ollie Robinson and South Africa Women captain Dane van Niekerk. Meanwhile, Wisden named Joe Root as 'Leading Cricketer of the Year'.

145.title: Ronaldo shares video of fans' gesture after newborn's death, says 'Will never forget this'
145.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo shared a video on Instagram showing football fans' gesture for him during Manchester United-Liverpool match at Anfield following the death of his newborn son. A fan-led minute's applause was held in the seventh minute as a tribute to Ronaldo's family. "Me and my family will never forget this moment of respect and compassion," Ronaldo wrote.

146.title: There needs to be some sense in their batting: Wasim Jaffer on PBKS
146.article_body: Talking about PBKS, ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said, "You 'live by the sword, die by the sword', but they are dying more than living. There needs to be some sense in their batting performance." PBKS were bowled out for 115 against DC which is the lowest total in IPL 2022 so far. DC defeated PBKS by nine wickets.

147.title: British fighters captured in Ukraine being fed, looked after: Russia
147.article_body: Russian Foreign Ministry said Moscow is "taking care" of British fighters who had been captured in Ukraine. "They are fed, watered, and given...necessary assistance. Just like other foreigners who've surrendered or been detained," it added. On Monday, the fighters appeared on Russian state TV and asked to be exchanged for Russian President Vladimir Putin's ally, Viktor Medvedchuk, held in Ukraine.

148.title: Russia has taken control of 80% of Ukraine’s Luhansk region: Guv
148.article_body: Russia has taken control of 80% of Ukraine's Luhansk region, Governor Serhiy Haidai has said. He said that having captured Kreminna, the Russians are threatening Rubizhne and Popasna cities. Haidai asked the residents in the region to evacuate immediately. Before the war began, the Ukrainian government reportedly controlled 60% of the region.

149.title: CSK's Adam Milne ruled out of IPL 2022, SL's Matheesha Pathirana to replace him
149.article_body: CSK pacer Adam Milne has been ruled out of IPL 2022 due to a hamstring injury, which he suffered in their first game of the season against KKR. Sri Lanka's 19-year-old pacer Matheesha Pathirana, who played the Under-19 World Cup 2022, has been named as his replacement. Pathirana had picked seven wickets in four games in the World Cup.

150.title: Not one drop of water will flow out of Punjab to other states: Cheema
150.article_body: Punjab Finance Minister Harpal Singh Cheema on Wednesday said that not even a single drop of the state's water will be allowed to flow out to any other state. His response came a day after AAP MP Sushil Gupta promised Sutlej Yamuna Link canal water to every village in Haryana if the party comes to power there.

151.title: 50-year-old woman, 2 sons found dead at brick kiln in Jharkhand
151.article_body: A 50-year-old woman and her two sons were found dead on Wednesday at a brick kiln in Jharkhand's Sahibganj district, police said. They went home along with other workers after it was lit at around 10 pm on Tuesday, police said. However, they returned to look after the brick kiln at 1 am following rainfall in the area.

152.title: I don't take my phones to meetings to avoid being spied on: EU tech chief
152.article_body: The EU's technology chief Margrethe Vestager advised not to take phones to important meetings to avoid digital espionage. "I'd leave my phones and my iPad outside of the room before entering," she said. "Most of my feed is so boring that even if you had access to it, you'd think oh my God, this woman...she has no life," she added.

153.title: Pant was the one who made Avesh Khan, now he's making Kuldeep: Kaif
153.article_body: Discussing DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav's performances in IPL 2022, ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif said, "[DC captain] Rishabh Pant was the one who made [pacer] Avesh Khan and [now he] is making Kuldeep." "Kuldeep has been told to go after the wickets, generally captains ask the bowlers to bowl tightly," added Kaif. Kuldeep has taken 13 wickets so far.

154.title: Commander of Russian sapper regiment killed in Ukraine: Reports
154.article_body: The commander of a Russian sapper regiment has reportedly been killed in Ukraine. Colonel Mikhail Nagamov, commander of the sixth engineer- sapper regiment of the Western Military District, was killed in Ukraine on April 13 "while performing a combat mission in Ukraine". At least eight generals and 35 colonels have died in Ukraine since Russia's invasion began on February 24.

155.title: Hyderabad sees hottest day of year with max temperature at 40.6°C
155.article_body: Amid rising temperatures, Hyderabad reported the season's highest temperature on Thursday with a maximum temperature of 40.6 degrees Celsius. The Meteorological Centre, Hyderabad, said, "The temperature in the city has been recorded at 40.6 degrees Celsius, it's the highest day temperature recorded in the year." Meanwhile, officials have urged people to avoid going to the sun between 12 pm-3 pm.

156.title: Hyd Police issues advisory to people as maximum temperature reaches 40°C
156.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Thursday issued an advisory to people as the maximum temperature rose to 40°C. It asked people to drink plenty of water, never leave children, adults or pets in the car, keep cool, schedule activities and help others. The maximum and minimum temperatures in the city are likely to settle at around 40°C and 26°C respectively.

157.title: Global COVID-19 cases, deaths fall for another week: WHO
157.article_body: In its weekly report, the World Health Organization said COVID-19 cases and deaths reported globally fell last week, continuing a decline since the end of March 2022. WHO said during the week of April 11 to 17 over five million cases and over 18,000 deaths were reported globally, a 24% and 12% decrease respectively compared to the previous week.

158.title: Need to integrate Ayurveda, Yoga with modern medical practices: Health Min
158.article_body: Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Thursday said there is a need to integrate indigenous medical systems like Ayurveda and Yoga with modern medical practices. This will help in providing holistic healthcare solutions to people, he said. Mandaviya added that while Ayurveda is effective in preventive healthcare, modern medicines, on the other hand, play key role in diagnosis and treatment.

159.title: PM Modi urges district officials to draw plans to implement govt schemes
159.article_body: On the occasion of 'Civil Services Day', PM Narendra Modi urged district officials to draw action plans to implement government schemes on ground. He asked civil servants to select any one scheme of the Central government and implement it in their districts. "Speak to former officers who served the district you are...deployed in and take their counsel," he added.

160.title: Amber admits to hitting Depp in recording of their fight, says 'You're a baby, grow up'
160.article_body: Amber Heard could be heard admitting to hitting Johnny Depp in a recording played in court. "I didn't punch you. I'm sorry I didn't hit you across the face in a proper slap, but I was hitting you, it was not punching you," she could be heard saying. "You are such a baby, grow the f**k up, Johnny," she said.

161.title: Death penalty of man who raped, killed 4-yr-old in MP commuted
161.article_body: The Supreme Court has commuted the death sentence of a man, who had raped and murdered a four-year-old girl in Madhya Pradesh in 2013, to 20-year imprisonment. The bench refused to sentence convict Mohd Firoz to imprisonment for the rest of his life, saying, "Every saint has a past and every sinner has a future."

162.title: Arjun undergoes pyshical transformation for 'Made in Heaven 2'; shares post
162.article_body: Actor Arjun Mathur underwent a physical transformation for his upcoming show 'Made in Heaven' season 2. When asked about it, he said, "I had a transformative experience while turning into Karan Mehra under the expert guidance of Samir Jaura." "He knows just how hard he needs to push for you to achieve a goal," he added.

163.title: Prashant Kishor wants to join the party without any preconditions: Cong Gen Secy
163.article_body: Congress General Secretary Tariq Anwar said that Prashant Kishor is willing to join the party without any preconditions and his induction would certainly help the party. He further said that Sonia Gandhi wants to take senior leaders into confidence and seek their opinion on Kishor's entry into the party. "Kishor is a brand and he has proven that," Anwar added.

164.title: Manchester United appoint Erik ten Hag as manager on 3-year deal
164.article_body: Manchester United on Thursday confirmed the appointment of Erik ten Hag as the club's new manager. The 52-year-old's tenure will begin from the end of the current season and go on till June 2025, the club announced. Erik ten Hag is currently the head coach Dutch club Ajax. He won Dutch Eredivisie with the club in 2018-19 and 2020-21.

165.title: Viral pic shows Class 10 students drinking beer in school hostel in Telangana
165.article_body: A picture showing Class 10 students of a government-run school in Telangana's Mancherial drinking beer in their hostel has gone viral on social media. Preliminary investigation by school authorities revealed that the students were celebrating a farewell party on the night of April 17. While an enquiry has been ordered, an officer said the hostel warden failed in his duties.

166.title: Tesla reports $3.32 bn profit in Q1, 658% rise year-on-year
166.article_body: Tesla has reported a $3.32 billion profit in the first quarter of 2022, a 658% increase from the $438 million reported in the same period last year. Its revenue for the quarter stood at  $18.76 billion, beating estimates of $17.85 billion. Tesla's revenue saw an 81% increase year-over-year, compared to $10.4 billion in revenue in Q1 2021.

167.title: Overwhelmed and grateful: Sanjay on fans cheering for him in cricket stadium
167.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt took to Instagram to share a video of his fans cheering for him when he visited a cricket stadium to support the IPL team Royal Challengers Bangalore. Dutt also posted a picture with actress Raveena Tandon from the stadium. He was seen sporting a T-shirt with name Adheera, which is his character's name in 'KGF: Chapter 2'.

168.title: 4 ivory artefacts seized by wildlife bureau in West Bengal, 1 held
168.article_body: Four ivory artefacts were seized at Kharsarai in West Bengal’s Hooghly on Wednesday. The seizure was made during a joint raid by officers of the Wildlife Crime Control Bureau (WCCB) of the Union Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change and the state forest department, officials said. “One person was arrested...The suspect wanted to sell the statues,” an official said.

169.title: Chinese national gets 20 yrs in jail in Rwanda for beating local man
169.article_body: A Chinese national has been sentenced to 20 years in prison by a Rwandan court for beating up a local man there last year. The accused, Sun Shujun, operated a mine in Rutsiro district and was purportedly filmed beating a man who was tied to a pole. A Rwandan man was also handed prison term for alleged role in crime.

170.title: I think he has much more to give to WI: Narine on Pollard's retirement
170.article_body: Reacting to WI limited-overs captain Kieron Pollard announcing his retirement from international cricket, WI spinner Sunil Narine said, "It's sad, I think he has much more to give to WI." Narine added, "They love to see him play in WI, but he knows best. I think he is going to focus more on T20 cricket around the world."

171.title: Punjab Army man cheated of ₹10 lakh on pretext of sending kin to Canada
171.article_body: A subedar with the Indian Army was allegedly cheated of ₹10 lakh by an ex-serviceman in Punjab on the pretext of sending his wife and son to Canada for jobs. The victim, a resident of Punjab’s Hoshiarpur, is posted in Bikaner, Rajasthan. The victim has posted videos on social media urging the Punjab CM and other ministers to take action.

172.title: Nigerian drug peddler held in B'luru; MDMA crystals worth ₹70 lakh seized
172.article_body: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) of Bengaluru Police have arrested a Nigerian drug peddler, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said in a tweet on Thursday. Police have also recovered 800 grams of MDMA crystals, estimated to be worth around ₹70 lakh, from his possession. Further, a mobile phone and electronic weighing machine have also been recovered.

173.title: A$AP Rocky released from jail after posting ₹4.2 cr bail bond: Report
173.article_body: Rapper A$AP Rocky who was recently arrested at the Los Angeles International Airport in connection with November 2021 shooting has reportedly been released after paying a bail amount of $550,000 (₹4.19 crore). According to the police, Rocky is accused of firing a handgun at a person on November 6, 2021, following an argument. The victim had suffered a minor injury.

174.title: I was pumped to try it: Ayushmann on portraying an undercover cop in Anek
174.article_body: Speaking about his character in his upcoming film 'Anek', Ayushmann Khurrana said, "[It's] the first time...audience will see me in this avatar. I've played a cop before but this is the first time they'll see me going undercover." "I was...pumped to try my hands at portraying 'Joshua' as it gave me...opportunity to explore something I hadn't done before," he added.
