"[It] was successfully launched from a silo at the Plesetsk state testing cosmodrome in Arkhangelsk Region," the tweet read. Russian President Vladimir Putin has said the missile can hit any target on Earth.

351.title: Assam boy develops theft-proof bicycle, can run 60km on single charge
351.article_body: A teenage boy, Samrat Nath, from Assam's Karimganj has developed a 'theft-proof' e-bicycle with modern sensors and it can run 60 kilometres on a single charge. It has lithium-ion batteries that were recycled from used laptops. "If anyone tries to steal my bike, a message will immediately pop up on...smartphone and theft alarm on bike will start ringing," he said.

352.title: Jahangirpuri demolition illegal, arbitrary; will burn country: Tharoor
352.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday said the demolition drive in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area was "illegal, arbitrary and unconstitutional". "Homes and shops were destroyed, it's an absolutely criminal act for which serious action should be taken. This is a new technique of intimidation that is going to burn our country down," Tharoor added.

353.title: DC chase down 116-run target in 63 balls, hand PBKS their 4th defeat
353.article_body: DC defeated PBKS by nine wickets at the Brabourne Stadium in Mumbai to jump to the sixth position on the IPL 2022 points table. PBKS were bowled out for 115 runs in 20 overs, the lowest total in IPL 2022 so far. DC chased down the 116-run target in 63 deliveries as PBKS lost their fourth match.

354.title: 'Vikram Vedha' is shaping up beautifully, it's very exciting: Neeraj
354.article_body: 'Vikram Vedha' producer Neeraj Pandey has said that the film, starring Hrithik Roshan and Saif Ali Khan, is shaping up beautifully. "It's very exciting. It's one of the best scripts that we have come across," he added. Speaking about the next season of 'Special Ops', he said, "It's due next year, bigger...better. We'll go on floors by early next year."

355.title: Man Utd confirm chief scout, head of global scouting leave the club
355.article_body: Manchester United on Wednesday confirmed that the club's chief scout Jim Lawlor and head of global scouting Marcel Bout have left the club. "Jim and Marcel leave the club with our warmest thanks for their significant contribution and our very best wishes for the future," a club spokesperson said. Manchester United are currently sixth on the Premier League table.

356.title: I call producers every night to confirm 'Jersey' release date: Shahid
356.article_body: Shahid Kapoor said he calls the producers of his film 'Jersey' every night to confirm if the film's release date is still the same. "Don't think people will give me another chance," he added. 'Jersey' was slated to release on December 31, 2021, but was postponed to April 14. It was delayed again and now it'll release on April 22.

357.title: Russia to update its strategy in WTO amid 'illegal' sanctions: Putin
357.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has termed the restrictions imposed by Western states on Russian companies amid its invasion of Ukraine "illegal". Putin said the sanctions ran counter to World Trade Organization rules and they'll update Russia's strategy in the WTO by June 1. Western countries banned Russia from buying components needed to produce rolled metal and other products, Putin added.

358.title: Can hit any target, will make enemies think twice: Putin as Russia tests new missile
358.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said Russia has successfully tested the Sarmat intercontinental ballistic missile, saying the weapon capable of carrying nuclear charges will make enemies "think twice". Dubbed Satan 2 by Western analysts, it's among Russia's next-generation missiles that Putin has called "invincible". Weighing more than 200 tonnes, Putin said it can hit any target on Earth.

359.title: Indian SaaS funding to rise 55% to $6.5 billion in 2022: Report
359.article_body: Software-as-a-service (SaaS) companies in India are expected to raise as much as $6.5 billion in 2022, a 55% increase from 2021, a report by investment firm Chiratae Ventures and management consultancy firm Zinnov revealed. The report added that some eight to 12 more SaaS companies are expected to turn unicorns this year. Currently, India has 17 SaaS unicorns.

360.title: 'Non-compete' clause in offer letter won't limit career growth: Infosys after backlash
360.article_body: Infosys, facing backlash for its 'non-compete' clause in offer letters to the employees, on Wednesday said that it won't limit the employees' career growth. The agreement reportedly says that an employee shall not accept an employment offer from "named competitors" for six months after they quit Infosys. The company reportedly named TCS, Wipro, and other major IT firms as competitors.

361.title: Fulham beat Preston to secure promotion back to Premier League
361.article_body: Fulham on Tuesday beat Preston North End 3-0 to secure promotion back to the Premier League after being relegated from the top flight of English football last year. Fulham currently have 86 points from 42 games which guarantees a top-two finish in the second-tier Championship. Fulham's Aleksandar Mitrovic scored twice in the game taking his overall tally to 40 goals.

362.title: He is a brilliant driver: Mercedes boss Wolff on Red Bull's Verstappen
362.article_body: Mercedes boss Toto Wolff said Red Bull's Max Verstappen is "a brilliant driver" adding he has a lot of respect for the "mature and intelligent" F1 world champion. "Max performed strongly all last year and he missed out on a lot of points," Wolff said. "I have a lot of respect for him and for his father, Jos," he added.

363.title: Punjab being used to increase AAP's footprint in other states: Cong
363.article_body: Congress leader Partap Singh Bajwa on Wednesday said Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal is using Punjab's resources, security and bureaucracy to leave "imprints in Haryana, Gujarat and Himachal Pradesh". He added that AAP MP Raghav Chadha takes calls on posting of IAS and IPS officers in Punjab. All of AAP's pre-poll promises are being tweaked, he added.

364.title: West Indies captain Kieron Pollard retires from international cricket aged 34
364.article_body: West Indies limited-overs captain Kieron Pollard today announced his retirement from international cricket at the age of 34. Pollard made his debut for West Indies in an ODI on April 10, 2007. He went on to play 123 ODIs and 101 T20Is for West Indies. He scored 4,275 runs and took 97 wickets in international cricket.

365.title: Punjab Kings record lowest total of IPL 2022 so far
365.article_body: Punjab Kings (PBKS) recorded the lowest total of IPL 2022 so far after being dismissed for 115 in 20 overs by Delhi Capitals (DC) at Brabourne Stadium in Mumbai. The previous lowest total in the ongoing edition was recorded by Chennai Super Kings (CSK) after they were bowled out for 126 runs in 18 overs against PBKS on April 3.

366.title: IFS officer shares pic of king cobra eating another cobra
366.article_body: IFS officer Parveen Kaswan has shared a picture of a king cobra eating a spectacled cobra and tweeted, "They feed on lesser mortals." "Scientific name of king cobra is: Ophiophagus hannah. 'Ophiophagus' is derived from Greek, meaning 'snake-eating' and hannah is derived from the name of tree-dwelling nymphs in Greek mythology. So king living true to its name," he added.

367.title: It felt good: Former world no. 3 Thiem on return to tennis from injury
367.article_body: Former world number three Dominic Thiem on Tuesday played his first tour-level match since last June after injuring his right wrist. Thiem lost 3-6, 6-4, 4-6 to John Millman at the Serbia Open. "Actually, I'm really happy because it was a match; it was a fight," Thiem said. The 28-year-old Austrian is currently ranked 54th in the world.

368.title: Woman cries as bulldozer demolishes her home in Delhi, Tharoor shares pic
368.article_body: A picture that has surfaced on social media shows a woman crying after a bulldozer demolishes her home during an anti-encroachment drive in Delhi's Jahangirpuri on Wednesday. Congress leader Shashi Tharoor shared the picture on his official Twitter handle. "Every man has become helpless...Now the political game has become very dirty," he captioned the picture.

369.title: Wimbledon bans Russian and Belarusian players from 2022 edition
369.article_body: Wimbledon banned Russian and Belarusian players from participating in the 2022 edition. "In...circumstances of such unjustified...military aggression, it'd be unacceptable for Russian regime to derive any benefits from...involvement of Russian or Belarusian players with [Wimbledon]," organisers said. "If circumstances change materially [by] June, we'll consider & respond accordingly," they added.

370.title: Brazil, Argentina to play friendly at Melbourne's MCG in June
370.article_body: The Victorian state government on Wednesday said Brazil and Argentina will play a friendly match at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG) on June 11. "Our expectation, based on the discussions we've had, is that players like [Lionel] Messi and Neymar will be here," the state's Sports Minister Martin Pakula said. Brazil and Argentina last played at the MCG in 2017.

371.title: Truck carrying cattle seized in Assam; 5 people arrested
371.article_body: The Assam Police has rescued 35 cattle and have arrested five persons on the charges of animal cruelty in Biswanath, Assam. A team of Biswanath police station reportedly intercepted a truck from the Biswanath area, based on secret information. "We have apprehended five persons and a case has been registered in connection with it," Navin Singh, Superintendent of Police, said.

372.title: Play with Ukrainian children to make them feel welcome: Norway PM to kids
372.article_body: Norwegian PM Jonas Gahr Store has urged the country's children to invite Ukrainian children, who've fled their country amid Russian invasion, to play with them and make them feel welcome. "If you...[play] chess or football, invite them to join you," Store told a news briefing for media dedicated to children. About 14,000 Ukrainians have so far sought refuge in Norway.

373.title: 4 planets to align this week, to be visible with naked eye
373.article_body: Four planets, Venus, Mars, Jupiter and Saturn, will align this week. Experts said the best viewing window is between 5 am and 6 am in the coming days. NASA had revealed that at the beginning of April, Mars, Venus and Saturn had formed a trio and now, the three planets have been joined by Jupiter.

374.title: Was crying as I hugged him: Ram on working with father in 'Acharya'
374.article_body: Ram Charan, speaking about working with his father Chiranjeevi in 'Acharya', has said, "Dad and I used to eat dinner together...then get up the next day to start working out together." While working together, Chiranjeevi reportedly told Charan that they'll be unable to relive these moments. To this, Ram said, "I was baffled. I was crying as I hugged him."

375.title: Germany rejects Russia's demand to pay for natural gas in rubles
375.article_body: German Finance Minister Christian Lindner on Wednesday said companies buying Russian natural gas shouldn't have to set up ruble accounts to pay for it. "Contracts are based on dollars and euros and so private-sector companies should pay in dollars or euros," Lindner said. Last month, Russian President Vladimir Putin had demanded "unfriendly countries" to pay for Russian gas in rubles.

376.title: BJP has made bulldozer a symbol of its illegal power: Akhilesh Yadav
376.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Wednesday said that the BJP has made bulldozers a symbol of its illegal power. "Muslims and other minorities, backward and Dalits are on their target. Now even Hindus are becoming victims of their hysteria. The BJP is actually running this bulldozer on the Constitution itself," Akhilesh added.

377.title: Netflix shares crash over 35% in their biggest fall in more than 10 years
377.article_body: Netflix shares crashed over 35% on Wednesday in their biggest drop since October 2011. The stock crashed after Netflix reported losing 2,00,000 customers in Q1 2022, marking the first time in more than 10 years that the company lost subscribers. At the time of writing, Netflix shares were trading at $224.68, shedding nearly a third of their value.

378.title: FIR filed against groom 1 day after Hindu outfit stops marriage in UP
378.article_body: A day after members of the Hindu Yuva Vahini forcibly stopped an inter-faith marriage in Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad, police on Tuesday filed an FIR against the groom for allegedly kidnapping the bride from Ludhiana. We informed Ludhiana police as the couple belonged to different religions and the woman's family had lodged a missing complaint, Moradabad Deputy SP Sagar Jain said.

379.title: Tharoor shares meaning of word 'quockerwodger', says 'useful addition to vocabulary'
379.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday shared the meaning of the word 'quockerwodger'. "A useful addition to our political vocabulary," he wrote with the meaning. "In politics, a quockerwodger was a politician acting on the instructions of an influential third party, rather than properly representing their constituents," the meaning stated.

380.title: Take back Padma awards from actors promoting tobacco: Goa BJP leader to PM
380.article_body: Goa BJP leader Shekhar Salkar has requested PM Narendra Modi to take back Padma awards from actors promoting tobacco products. "I have no words to condemn the way Akshay Kumar has joined the gang of Amitabh Bachchan, Shahrukh Khan, Ajay Devgn to promote cancer through a surrogate advertisement of tobacco product," he said. He added these actors should be ashamed.

381.title: Haven't consciously stayed away from Bollywood: Nimrat Kaur
381.article_body: Nimrat Kaur said she has not stayed away from Bollywood consciously. "I genuinely wanted to work on more projects," she added. Nimrat said that she went to shoot for an American TV show 'Wayward Pines' after completing the 2016 film 'Airlift'. After 'Airlift', Nimrat starred in 'Dasvi'. In 2017, she featured in the Hindi web series 'The Test Case'.

382.title: Delhi sees over 1,000 new COVID-19 cases, 60% jump in single day
382.article_body: Delhi on Wednesday reported 1,009 fresh cases of COVID-19, which is around 60% higher than 632 cases the city recorded on Tuesday. One person died of COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, while the positivity rate rose to 5.70% from 4.42%. The number of active cases in the national capital jumped to 2,641 from 1,274 on Tuesday.

383.title: Tata Steel to stop business with Russia over Ukraine invasion
383.article_body: Tata Steel has taken a "conscious" decision to stop doing business with Russia, the steel major said on Wednesday amid the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war. It stated, "Tata Steel doesn't have any operations or employees in Russia." All of the company's manufacturing sites in India, the UK and the Netherlands have sourced alternative supplies of raw materials, it added.

384.title: Biliti to set up world's largest electric 3-wheeler plant in T'gana
384.article_body: US-based Biliti Electric will invest $150 million to set up the world's largest electric three-wheeler production facility in Telangana, the company said in a statement. The facility, set up over a 200-acre area, will have a production capacity of 2,40,000 vehicles/year. The facility's first phase, with production capacity of 18,000 vehicles/year, is expected to be operational in early 2023.

385.title: Adani to invest ₹10,000 crore in West Bengal, to create 25,000 jobs
385.article_body: Adani Group Chairman and Founder Gautam Adani has announced that the company will invest around ₹10,000 crore in West Bengal in the next few years. "This will provide direct and indirect employment to around 25,000 people," Adani stated. He added that the investment will be made in sectors like under-sea cable, data centre and warehouses.

386.title: Bulldozer runs only on Ansar, not Arjun; punishment for Muslims: Owaisi
386.article_body: President of All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday said that the bulldozer runs only on Ansar, not on Arjun, adding that "collective punishment" is being given to Muslims. He also asked why only shops in front of the mosques were demolished and not ones in front of the temples. "This is a targeted demolition," Owaisi added.

387.title: Butterfly-shaped house with no walls goes on sale for ₹52cr in Greece; pics surface
387.article_body: A house designed in the shape of a butterfly is up for sale on the coastline of Greece for £5.2 million (around ₹52 crore). The 5,381-sqft house has no walls and is said to have four bedrooms, four bathrooms, and an indoor pool among other luxury amenities. Viewed from above, the house emulates two wings and body of a butterfly.

388.title: Treat Briton, who was captured in Ukraine, with care: UK PM to Russia
388.article_body: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson urged Russia to treat a Briton, who was captured in Ukraine, humanely and compassionately. PM Johnson said, "I understand that he had been serving in the Ukrainian forces for some time and his situation was very different from that of a mercenary." "I hope that he's treated with care and compassion," the UK PM added.

389.title: Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Delhi Files' faces objection from Sikh group, director reacts
389.article_body: Filmmakers should "desist from disturbing...uneasy calm in society", the Maharashtra Sikh Association said after Vivek Agnihotri announced his next movie 'The Delhi Files'. "I'm an Indian, I live in a sovereign state...I'll make what I need to make...I'm not a servant to anybody's demands," Agnihotri said. There has been speculation that 1984 anti-Sikh riots will feature in the film.

390.title: Microsoft India to help SaaS startups build core AI models
390.article_body: Microsoft on Wednesday announced two new initiatives to "strengthen" support for startups in India. As per the announcement, Microsoft AI Innovate will introduce its second cohort, which will let SaaS (Software as a Service) startups partner with Microsoft's engineering and product teams to build their core AI models. A hackathon aiming to create digital solutions will also be organised.

391.title: Nissan to discontinue Datsun brand in India
391.article_body: Nissan is discontinuing Datsun brand in India, the company said on Wednesday. India was one of the last markets where Datsun was still operational after its global relaunch failed and it was discontinued in Russia and Indonesia in 2020. "Datsun redi-GO production has ceased at the Chennai plant...sales of the model still continue (till the stock lasts)," Nissan India said.

392.title: India to provide additional $500 million to Sri Lanka to buy fuel
392.article_body: Sri Lankan Foreign Minister GL Peiris on Wednesday said India will provide an additional $500 million in financial assistance to the country for it to buy fuel. Previously, India sent nearly 76,000 MT of fuel to Sri Lanka, taking the total supply of various types of fuels under Indian assistance to Sri Lanka to 2,70,000 MT.

393.title: Bulldoze BJP HQ to stop hooliganism in country: Manish Sisodia
393.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia on Wednesday said that the BJP headquarters should be bulldozed to stop hooliganism in the country. "The illegal constructions have been demolished, now the homes of those BJP netas should be demolished who gave protection to them," Sisodia said. BJP has only encouraged fighting and has done nothing for schools and hospitals, he added.

394.title: Target not breached 'so badly': FM on 17-month-high inflation
394.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said India hasn't breached the inflation target "so badly". Her statement came after India's retail inflation rose to a 17-month high of about 6.95% in March against 6.07% in February. "Our tolerance band is just 4%, plus or minus 2%...So we might go as much as 6%," she stated during her US visit.

395.title: UK PM Johnson to begin 2-day India visit tomorrow, to meet PM Modi
395.article_body: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson is scheduled to begin his two-day visit to India tomorrow. He will visit Gujarat on April 21 and hold consultations with PM Narendra Modi on April 22. On Sunday, Boris had said, "My visit to India will deliver on...things that...matter to the people of both...nations...from job creation and economic growth to energy security and defence."

396.title: Bomb blast hits crowded restaurant in Nigeria; 3 killed, 19 injured
396.article_body: At least three people were killed and 19 others injured in a blast in east Nigeria's Taraba state on Tuesday, reports stated. The incident reportedly took place at a crowded restaurant located in Irawe town of Taraba, a police spokesperson was quoted as saying. "It's suspected to have been caused by an improvised explosive device that detonated," the spokesperson added.

397.title: DC to bowl first against PBKS, Sarfaraz Khan replaces COVID-19 +ve Mitchell Marsh
397.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) captain Rishabh Pant won the toss and elected to bowl first against Punjab Kings (PBKS) in their IPL 2022 clash on Wednesday. DC have made one change to their playing XI, with Sarfaraz Khan replacing Mitchell Marsh, who recently tested positive for COVID-19. Meanwhile, Nathan Ellis replaced Odean Smith in PBKS' playing XI.

398.title: Farah shares old pic of Abhishek, Hrithik from her sangeet; fans react
398.article_body: Filmmaker-choreographer Farah Khan shared an old picture of actors Abhishek Bachchan and Hrithik Roshan from her sangeet function on Instagram. "Found an almost vintage pic of these two boys...Abhishek and Hrithik dancing up a storm. Can't remember to which song. I was too drunk," Farah captioned the post. "One of the best duos, best cop and thief," a user commented.

399.title: Did 80 shows in 2019, missed playing live during pandemic: Prateek Kuhad
399.article_body: Singer Prateek Kuhad has revealed that he did around 80 live shows while touring in 2019. "I was exhausted by the end of 2019...I did feel a sense of relief [when the lockdown happened] because I didn't have to play shows," he stated. Prateek added that he started missing the stage and playing live after a year into the pandemic.

400.title: Gang of fake Microsoft workers busted in Gurugram, 3 women among 14 held
400.article_body: The Gurugram Police on Wednesday busted a gang of fake Microsoft workers and arrested 14 people, including three women, for cheating US nationals by sending pop-ups on their computer screens. The police raided the call centre in Gurugram and seized 14 laptops, nine mobile phones and over ₹1.10 lakh in cash, reports said.

401.title: Fire breaks out at Delhi's Ghazipur landfill site for 3rd time since Mar 28
401.article_body: Another fire broke out at the Ghazipur landfill site in east Delhi on Wednesday, nearly 10 days after a massive fire broke out at the same site. A total of nine fire tenders were rushed to the spot to bring the blaze under control. This is the third fire incident at the landfill site since March 28.

402.title: Did a line or two of cocaine with Amber Heard's sister, admits Johnny Depp in court
402.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp, during a defamation trial, admitted to doing "a line or two" of cocaine with his ex-wife Amber Heard's sister, Whitney. He said Heard's allegations of substance abuse have been "grossly embellished" and that there have been no moments where he's been out of control. "I'm not some maniac who needs to be high...all the time," Depp stated.
